definition: spout/spray/belch/to well up/to puff out/to spurt out
(of a smell) strong/peak season (of a crop)/(classifier for the ordinal number of a crop, in the context of multiple harvests)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: This method can be applied in rifted basin with abundant effusive rocks.
sentences.chinese: 该方法在喷出岩较发育的断陷盆地中可以广泛应用。

sentences.english: A volcano belches smoke and ashes.
It flamed out and fell heavily on the table.
sentences.chinese: 那机器人最终喷出火花重重地摔在桌面上。

sentences.english: The cork popped out and the champagnegushed from the bottle.
sentences.chinese: 软木塞啪地一声蹦了出来，香槟就从瓶口喷出来了。

sentences.english: Jets of water kept coming out of the broken pipe. Even the street had to be closed.
sentences.chinese: 管线破掉，不断地喷出水柱，连街道都必须封锁了。

sentences.english: They would have been belching hydrogen sulfide and other gases.
sentences.chinese: 它们可以喷出硫化氢和其它的气体。

sentences.english: Water was spouting out from a broken watermain.
sentences.chinese: 水从破裂的自来水主管中喷出。

sentences.english: Drove through Braulio Carrillo Park, the smoke (red arrow) came from this active volcano which I didn't catch the name.
sentences.chinese: 红箭咀指著的烟雾是由这个不知名的活火山喷出的。

sentences.english: A great poem is a fountain forever overflowing with the waters of wisdom and delight (P.B.Shelley, British poet)
sentences.chinese: 伟大的诗篇即是永远喷出智慧和欢欣之水的喷泉。

sentences.english: Rook goosed the throttle, and the bike sent up a cloud of white smoke.
sentences.chinese: 露可加大了油门，摩托车喷出一阵白烟。

sentences.english: The shower threw a hard tight stream.
sentences.chinese: 淋浴喷水器喷出一股急流。

sentences.english: Would gush, flush, green these mountains and these valleys.
sentences.chinese: 将奋力喷出，冲刷涤荡，灌绿青山和这些山谷。

sentences.english: Water spouted from the break of the pipe.
Steam and hot water erupt from geysers.
sentences.chinese: 从间歇泉中喷出蒸汽和热水。

sentences.english: Lava boiled up from the crater of the volcano.
Kasatochi, Okmok and Cleveland all spewed giant ash plumes into the air.
sentences.chinese: 奥克莫克和骑士都喷出火山灰在空中巨人羽。

definition: stream of water (as from a fountain or a faucet)/jet of water
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to breathe in/to suck in/to inhale
